Detailed Description

Class to represent the fundamental matrix between two views

Member Function Documentation

template<class DERIVED1, class DERIVED2>
void FundamentalMatrix::eight_point_algorithm ( const Eigen::MatrixBase< DERIVED1 > &  a,
const Eigen::MatrixBase< DERIVED2 > &  b 
) [inline]

Sets '*this' fundamental matrix from a set of corresponding pixels from two separate views using the 8-point algorithm. The inputs 'a' and 'b' are 3xN matrices whose columns contain pixel coordinates in the form (s.x,s.y,s)^T where s is an arbitrary scale. Corresponding columns in 'a' and 'b' represent corresponding pixels in the two views. The number of correspondences must be at least 8 but may be more. Pixels with a scale of zero are assumed to be occluded and so are ignored.

In order to ensure stability, the pixel coordinates should have previously been normalised to have zero average and unit standard deviation. For more details, see Hartley, R.I. 1997: In defense of the eight-point algorithm. IEEE Trans. Patt. Anal. Mach. Int. 19:580-593.

Parameters:
a the pixels from the first camera in the form of a 3xN matrix
b the pixels from the second camera in the form of a 3xN matrix

void FundamentalMatrix::calc_epipoles_and_constrain (  ) 

Calculates the epipoles of this matrix and enforces the epipolar constraint. After execution the epipoles are stored in 'eij' and 'eji'.
